titleStmt.title: A disswasive from worldly-mindedness, in order to the due exercise of Christian charity A sermon preached in the chappel of Popler, on the 8th of Sept. 1698. Before the trustees for the charity of Captain William Curtis, deceased. Who, in the year 1669, bequeathed a rent-charge of sixty pounds per annum, for the release of poor prisoners, the relief of aged people, a weekly distribution of bread, and the placing out of poor children to trades: for the benefit of the poor in the hamlets of Popler, Mile-end, Limus, and Ratcliff, for ever. Published at the request of the trustees. By Josiah Woodward, minister of Popler.
titleStmt.author: Woodward, Josiah, 1660-1712.

Published at the request of the trustees. By Josiah Woodward, minister of Popler.
titleStmt.author: Woodward, Josiah, 1660-1712.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Brabazon Aylmer, at the Three Pigeons over against the Royal Exchange in Cornhil,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
